Coming from the Final Fantasy I on Google Play, this game uses many familiar controls but with enough new innovations to keep things fresh. Spells can be single-target or cast on a whole group. In the opening area, if you head in the wrong direction you'll find yourself fighting monsters that can kill you in one shot. Once the party all dies, you can resume your game, but unlike in FF1 you'll only get to take 1 step before a battle starts.. meaning you'll find yourself in this endless cycle where you're forced to load from a save point or start over. Save your game in a bad area? Start the game over again! Be super careful where you save!  There's also a technical problem in the character menus (magic, status, etc).. On my Nexus 6, the left/right arrow buttons are extremely sensitive and even trying to press the button as quick as I can results in a long enough press that it moves at least twice. With a max of 4 characters, supporting a long press on these buttons seems unnecessary to begin with.

I have been dissatisfied with how Square Enix has continued to short change the Android community by leaving out the simplest things compared to the IOS and Windows versions of this game.  In FFI all the extra content + the mini game was omitted.  It is only the mini-game for FFII as far as I can tell, but I refuse to reward SE with anything higher than 1 star.

I like the core gameplay a lot - the proficiency system is a unique and interesting take on the level-up system, and the keyword system makes for more interactive and engaging dialog.   That said, the production values in this version are very subpar for what I've come to expect from Square Enix - some graphics have texture filtering while others don't, the graphics that are filtered have visible seams, the letters that hang down (q, y, p, g) are raised up out of alignment with the other letters, and the music doesn't loop properly with many tracks fading out before repeating.    There are also some consistent crashes, one triggered by pressing the back button, the other triggered by trying to start the game without an active Internet connection (I didn't realize this one at first and tried fixing the issue by clearing cache, clearing data, and eventually reinstalling, resulting in the loss of my save data).    Overall, I'd say it's definitely a game worth playing, but unless they give it some much needed updates here on the Google Play Store, I'd advise playing it somewhere else.
